text:
I like your new haircut, Rob,
makes you look years younger.

Trevor, I think you need to
better put on your glasses.
[LAUGHS]

Welcome Jonathan Taylor to
this statistical learning team.

The statistical
learning edX course

was developed by Rob
Tibshirani and myself in 2014,
with an updated edition in 2021.

The course explains the
concepts of statistical learning

and it is based on our book
co-authored with Gareth James

and Daniela Witten called An
Introduction to Statistical

Learning with Applications
in R. The second edition
was published in 2021.

Here we present a new
course, statistical learning

with Python, along with our
new co-author and Python
expert, Jonathan Taylor.
Thank you, Trevor.

The course is based on our
new book, An Introduction

to Statistical Learning
with Applications in Python.

In the course and in
the book, all the labs

at the end of each chapter
are implemented in Python.

We provide Jupyter Python
notebooks as well as
a Python package ISLP.

The package contains all the
data sets used in the book,

along with many new and useful
tools for statistical modeling.
Wowzers, Jonathan.
I'm so excited about this book.
Oof, wowzers.
That's a bit sus, Trevor.

I think that goes
back to the '80s.
Oof, you're right.
Yeet!

Great to have you
on board, Jonathan.

Jonathan is an
early Python adopter

and has made many
contributions to the community.

Like the earlier book,
the PDF of this book

is available for free from
the Stat Learning website,
along with Python resources.
We hope you enjoy the class.
